result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Kyle Dean Hines
Current: 303 Hill Rd., PO Box 83, Plum City, WI 54761   (Effective: 03-08-2022)
Prior: 303 Hill Rd., Plum City, WI 54761
Partial cash bond posted on 8/23/2022 refunded to person who posted.
To Signature Bond

10:38 AM Defendant Kyle Dean Hines appeared by video from the Pepin County Jail with Attorney S. Joseph Randtke by video.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Mr. Hines  knowingly & voluntarily waives personal appearance.  Mr. Randtke's client is wishing to waive his P.H.  Mr. Randtke has spoken with Mr. Seifert and agree to $5000 signature bond. Court advises defendant of right to PH.   Court finds Mr. Hines waiver of PH done knowingly & voluntarily and bind over for trial.  Mr. Randtke willing to proceed with arraignment and his client stands mute.  State has just signed the Information and represent it will be the same as the complaint in this matter.  Court will enter NGP and set for STC.  Mr. Seifert has reviewed counsel's motion for bond modification along with accompanying materials and reviewed it with Mr. Randtke and the fact that Mr. Hines has been incarcerated for about 40 days, on probation through another county, working with H.S. in another county, subject to drug testing and believe he now understands and has no objection with condition: no possession of alcohol or controlled substances and no operation mv w/o valid license.  Court will adopt motion to modify bond to $5000 signature bond with conditions:  Not possess or consume alcohol; no entry into bars or taverns purpose is for consumption; no possession or consumption of controlled substance without a valid prescription; no operation of motor vehicle without a valid license.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on November 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Letter to Judge from C.H.
Motion to Modify Bond
Letter from C.H.

Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Amended Order Appointing County Appointed Attorney - $100.00 per month payments to commence 10-12-2022 and on the same day of each and every month thereafter.  See Order

records.addlTxt: 12:37 PM Defendant Kyle Dean Hines appeared by zoom technology by video from the Pepin County Jail with Attorney S. Joseph Randtke by video.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  22CM07, 22CF08 called.  Court advises Mr. Hines of right to PH.  Mr. Hines continue to WTL for PH but not PH itself.  Court finds KVI WTL for PH.  Mr. Randtke filed substitution and ask 22CM07 be substituted as well.  You cannot substitute on 22CM07 as judgment has already been entered.  Mr. Hines was convicted in 22CM07 and ordered to pay $143 and you FTP.  The Court will order you either pay the $143.00 or sit 3 days jail for contempt of court.  In 20CM07 he was ordered to pay $443.00, paid $300.00 and still owes $143.00 + interest $21.15.  Mr. Hines could pay after released.  20CM07 will track along with this case and when released from the PCJ,  all the time you are serving is on bond and when that bond is completed, you owe $143 + interest which is 3 days jail for contempt.  It will be assessed when you are released from bond.   Mr. Hines inquires if he pays bail, does he still have a 3 day hold?  You understand it right.  The new judge will give a new date.  Mr. Hines as an attorney payment due on 9/12 and asks for a one month extension.  Payment plan of $100/mo. to com. 10/12 and the first of ea. mo. thereafter.
Hearing on August 29, 2022 at 12:30 pm.
Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge and request PH be converted to WTL to allow a new judge to be assigned.
Partial cash bond posted

12:44 PM Defendant Kyle Dean Hines appeared by zoom technology by video from the Pepin County Jail.  Attorney S. Joseph Randtke appeared by video for Kyle Dean Hines.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Mr. Hines previously appeared was informed of his charges and rights.  Mr. Randtke was appointed as Mr. Hines was not eligible for PD services and Mr. Randtke requested a bail hearing today.  Mr. Randtke - Bond previously set $5000 and Mr. Hines cannot afford that bond.  His Dad has limited funds and he works with his Dad and he would be willing to post some cash, about $1500 and would also have to pay the monitoring for about 3 weeks as well.  He was recently put on probation.  He has a case out of St. Croix and working with his attorney to remedy that matter.  We ask court reduce bond to $1500.  Mr. Seifert - State's position is the seriousness of these crimes, mandatory 3 year prison sentence, what does not appear on his record is OWI in St. Croix County.  He has 6 prior OWI convictions.  There is the allegation regarding the St. Croix Co. matter and this Pepin Co. matter. A high cash bond remains appropriate and ask the Court continue the $5000 cash bond.  If he's able to post that bond, ask Mr. Hines be on a sober link device and not operate any mv without an appropriate license.  Court - Mr. Hines demonstrated he is a flight risk and cash bond remains of $5000.  Mr. Randtke ask for PH within 10 days.  Mr. Randtke requests by zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 12:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2022 at 12:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on August 23, 2022 at 12:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:54 PM Defendant Kyle Dean Hines in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Mr. Hines requested a PH but does not have counsel.  A notice was sent from the PD office that you were not eligible for PD services.  Would you like a court appointed attorney?  Yes. I would not have an attorney for your today to have a PH. Court will appoint Attorney Joseph Randtke and you will pay the county at the rate of $100/mo. com. 9/1.  We can set the PH on 9/6.  Mr. Hines requests to pay attorney fees on the 12th of the month.  Pay $100/mo. on 9/12 and the 12th every month thereafter until paid.  The COC will notify Mr. Randtke he was appointed and you should contact him.  The COC will give you his contact information.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: If released on cash bond you will be required to be monitored on a sober link device and have paid a 2 week deposit before you are released.

12:08 PM Defendant Kyle Dean Hines appeared by video from the Pierce County Jail.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Court advised defendant of 22CF08 charges in criminal complaint/max. penalties and rights. Given the gravity of offense alleged and open warrants and cases in other jurisdiction, this warrant been in effect for a long time, State thinks a $5000 cash bond appropriate.  Mr. Hines informs he normally doesn't miss court except when starts using and get off task; work with his father in Pepin and Stockholm and ask a lower bond can only come up with $500.  The criminal complaint was issued in March, 2022.  A summons was issued for you to appear on 4/5/2022, you did not appear nor contact the DA about your failure to appear.  There is a minimum prison sentence for this allegation of not less than 3 years if convicted for count 1 & 2.  Court finds you are a flight risk and believe the DA's recommendation appropriate and impose a $5000 cash bond and if released, you will be required to be monitored on sober link device and have paid a 2 week deposit before you are released of approximately $275.00.  Advised of right to PH within 10 days unless post cash bond.  Do you want a PH within 10 days or wait for counsel to be appointed.  Defendant requests PH w/in 10 days in person.  All parties will be in person.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

03:14 PM Defendant Kyle Dean Hines not in court. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  A summons was issued for Mr. Hines to appear today at 1:30 p.m. and he fails to appear.  Warrant requested by the State and authorized by the Court.
